title: iSignthis and Red 5's unforgettable breastfeeding antics
text:
Still on iSignthis and on Monday, the ASX-suspended fintech finally clarified its relationship with its own substantial (10.43 per cent) shareholder, Red 5 Solutions of the British Virgin Islands. It described Red 5 as “the entity that holds Performance Rights on behalf of a number of early-stage staff” and confirmed that one of its owners is Andrew Karantzis, iSignthis’ chief sales officer and the brother of chief executive John Karantzis. What’s more, Red 5’s company secretary is Irene Naumova, Andrew’s wife.

For nearly four weeks, iSignthis had maintained – bizarrely, given what we now know – it was “not privy to ownership of entities on our register”. That’s right, an internationally esteemed Know Your Customer platform claimed for a month not to know the identity of its second-largest shareholder (to which it had already issued 130 million performance shares), then abruptly disclosed its ownership by a member of both executive management and the CEO’s family. Witching.

You might forget your brother’s birthday, but forgetting he owns a slab of your company while sharing an office with him?

Regardless, you could never forget his wife. When not administering the affairs of Red 5 or cavorting around Cyprus, Irina (as she goes by on social media) is a passionate advocate for breastfeeding older children. On her Facebook page, Moo Moo Time (no kidding), she is shown heavily pregnant and suckling her three-year-old daughter while also embracing her six-year-old son. In another photo, Naumova tandem feeds the young girl and the newborn.

This is easily the most outlandish parenting exhibition we’ve seen since Jo Walker, wife of then BT chief Brad Cooper, photographed their daughter all over Europe dressed as the Bride of Chucky (and called it #twinning). Freak.

Naumova was a Miss Universe Western Australia finalist in 2014. At her pageant, the aspiring beauty queen identified lifelong lactation, not world peace, as her cause célèbre.

So perhaps Red 5 isn't a family warehouse through which to tunnel cash out of iSignthis, but the seed fund for a global campaign of a breastfeeding princess. Eminently forgettable. Almost slipped our minds too…
